section.name: Introduction
section.p: By default, CLI uses a POSIX style argument parser. This parser only provides support for single character options. To provide support for an application like Ant it is necessary to use the GNU style argument parser. This provides support for multi character options. Read on to discover how to configure this parser and also how to process the command line options.

section.name: Configuring the GNU Parser
section.p: CLI provides support for multiple parsers. The org.apache.commons.cli.parser system property is used to determine what parser to use. To change the parser set the system property to the class name of the required parser.

section.name: Creating the Ant Options
section.p:
There are three types of Options used in Ant. They are:
boolean option - the option is either present or not
value option - the option is present and requires a value
property option - the same style as Java system properties. For example, "-Dproperty=value".
